newsitem.title: CHILE: Chilean shares end soft on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Chilean shares end soft on profit-taking.

text.p: Snapping a three-day winning streak, Chilean stocks skidded to close lower as local investors cashed in gains from the rally, said traders.
Profit-taking is seen dragging stocks down further at the opening.
"Tomorrow, the bourse will fall again, but the drop will be more moderate than today," said one dealer.
The 40-share index ended down 0.54 percent at 116.82 points. The general index lost 0.44 percent to 5,379.29 points amid strong volume of 16.3 billion pesos.
Traders noted a wave of buy orders from foreign investors for power utilities Chilgener and Chilectra.
These stocks were among the few blue chip gainers, with Chilgener rising 2.62 percent to 2,740 pesos.
Other winners included drug-maker LabChile, up 2.41 percent at 425 pesos and forestry firm Masisa, which rose 2.04 percent at 225 pesos.
Losers included pension fund manager Provida, down 4.5 percent at 8,500 pesos, and juice producer Jucosa, which shed 4.26 percent to 18 pesos.
